title: Śrī Nṛsiṁha Kavaca Stotram (Prahlāda Kṛta)
author: Prahlāda Mahārāja (as recorded in the Brahmāṇḍa Purāṇa)
introduction: This is the complete text of the Nṛsiṁha-kavaca Stotram, considered one of the most powerful protective hymns in the Vedic tradition. It was spoken by Prahlāda Mahārāja and is found in the Brahmāṇḍa Purāṇa. The Kavaca provides a spiritual shield, invoking Lord Nṛsiṁha's fierce protection for every part of the devotee's body, mind, and spirit.

chapters.name: Dhyānam and Kavacha Mantras
chapters.summary: The first section begins with the Phalaśruti (benefits) and Dhyānam (meditation on the Lord's form), followed by the specific verses that invoke Nṛsiṁha's protection for individual body parts and directions.

verses.original: नृसिंहकवचं वक्ष्ये प्रह्लादेनॊदितं पुरा । सर्वरक्षाकरं पुण्यं सर्वॊपद्रवनाशनम् ॥
verses.transliteration: nṛsiṁhakavacaṁ vakṣyē prahlādēnōditaṁ purā | sarvarakṣākaraṁ puṇyaṁ sarvōpadravanāśanam ||

translations.english: I shall now recite the Nṛsiṁha-kavaca, formerly spoken by Prahlāda Mahārāja. It is most pious, provides all protection, and vanquishes all kinds of impediments.

verses.original: सर्वसम्पत्करं चैव स्वर्गमॊक्षप्रदायकम् । ध्यात्वा नृसिंहं देवेशं हेमसिंहासने स्थितम् ॥
verses.transliteration: sarvasampatkaraṁ caiva svargamōkṣapradāyakam | dhyātvā nṛsiṁhaṁ dēvēśaṁ hēmasiṁhāsanasthitam ||

translations.english: It bestows all opulences and grants elevation to the heavenly planets or liberation. One should meditate on Lord Nṛsiṁha, the Lord of the universe, seated upon a golden throne.

verses.original: स्वहृत्कमलसंवासं कृत्वा तु कवचं पठेत् । नृसिंहो मे शिरः पातु लॊकरक्षार्थसम्भवः ॥
verses.transliteration: svahr̥tkamalasaṁvāsaṁ kr̥tvā tu kavacaṁ paṭhēt | nr̥siṁhō mē śiraḥ pātu lōkarakṣātmasambhavaḥ ||

translations.english: Having seated Lord Nṛsiṁha upon the lotus of one's heart, one should recite the Kavaca. May Lord Nṛsiṁha, who appears for the protection of the worlds, protect my head.

verses.original: सर्वगॊऽपि स्तम्भवसः फालं मे रक्षतु ध्वनिम् । नृसिंहो मे दृशौ पातु सॊमसूर्याग्निलॊचनः ॥
verses.transliteration: sarvagō'pi stambhavāsaḥ phālaṁ mē rakṣatu dhvanim | nr̥siṁhō mē dr̥śau pātu sōmasūryāgnilōcanaḥ ||

translations.english: Although all-pervading, He resided within a pillar; may He protect my speech and the results of my activities. May Nṛsiṁha, whose eyes are the moon, sun, and fire, protect my eyes.

verses.original: सर्वविद्याधिपः पातु नृसिंहो रसनां मम । वक्त्रं पात्विन्दुवदनः सदा प्रह्लादवन्दितः ॥
verses.transliteration: sarvavidyādhipaḥ pātu nr̥siṁhō rasanāṁ mama | vaktraṁ pātvinduvadanaḥ sadā prahlādavanditaḥ ||

translations.english: May the Lord of all sciences, Nṛsiṁha, protect my sense of taste. May He whose face is beautiful as the moon and is always worshiped by Prahlāda protect my face.

verses.original: नृसिंहः पातु मे कण्ठं स्कन्धौ भूभरणान्तकृत् । दिव्यास्त्रशॊभितभुजॊ नृसिंहः पातु मे भुजौ ॥
verses.transliteration: nr̥siṁhaḥ pātu mē kaṇṭhaṁ skandhau bhūbharaṇāntakr̥t | divyāstraśōbhitabhujō nr̥siṁhaḥ pātu mē bhujau ||

translations.english: May Nṛsiṁha protect my throat; the annihilator of the earth's burden protect my shoulders. May He whose arms are resplendent with divine weapons protect my arms.

verses.original: करौ मे दॆववरदॊ नृसिंहः पातु सर्वतः । हृदयं यॊगिसाध्यश्च निवासं पातु मे हरिः ॥
verses.transliteration: karau mē dēvavaradō nr̥siṁhaḥ pātu sarvataḥ | hr̥dayaṁ yōgisādhyaś ca nivāsaṁ pātu mē hariḥ ||

translations.english: May the bestower of boons to the demigods, Nṛsiṁha, protect my hands and everything around me. May He who is attained by Yogis protect my heart, and may Hari protect my dwelling place.

verses.original: महॊग्रः पूर्वतः पातु महावीराग्रजॊऽग्नितः । महाविष्णुर्दक्षिणे तु महाज्वालस्तु नैर्रृतॆ ॥
verses.transliteration: mahōgraḥ pūrvataḥ pātu mahāvīrāgrajō:'gnitaḥ | mahāviṣṇurdakṣiṇē tu mahājvālastu nairr̥tē ||

translations.english: May the most ferocious one protect me from the East. May the superior of the greatest heroes protect me from the Southeast (Agni). May Mahāviṣṇu protect me from the South, and may the great flame protect me from the Southwest (Nairṛti).

verses.original: ईशान्यां पातु भद्रो मे सर्वमङ्गलदायकः । संसारभयतः पातु मृत्यॊर्मृत्युर्नृकॆसरी ॥
verses.transliteration: īśānyāṁ pātu bhadrō mē sarvamaṅgaladāyakaḥ | saṁsārabhayataḥ pātu mr̥tyōrmr̥tyurnr̥kēsarī ||

translations.english: May the All-Auspicious Lord, the bestower of all blessings, protect me from the Northeast (Īśāna). May the Death of Death, Nṛkēsarī (Man-Lion), protect me from the fear of the cycle of birth and death.

verses.original: इदं नृसिंहकवचं प्रह्लादमुखमण्डितम् । भक्तिमान् यः पठेनित्यं सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते ॥
verses.transliteration: idaṁ nr̥siṁhakavacaṁ prahlādamukhamaṇḍitam | bhaktimān yaḥ paṭhēnityaṁ sarvapāpaiḥ pramucyatē ||

translations.english: This Nṛsiṁha-kavaca, which is ornamented by issuing from the mouth of Prahlāda Mahārāja, a devotee who reads it daily becomes freed from all sins.
